channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole related to roadwork near the pavement of queenstown road, 20th January
item.description:
This is not my usual road, some road work beside the pavement cutting the cycling route with uneven surface and a pothole that is dangerous for Brompton bikes due to their wheel small size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 374, Queenstown Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bottles, 20th January
item.description:
The location of this problem has already been reported here with various bags of rubbish being dumped, but now on a daily basis there is broken bottles with lots of glass littering the pathway of the pavement from the alleyway between Springfield Gardens/Springfield Road and Fairmead Close. This area seems to being used as a dumping ground. There is a disguarded christmas tree complete with a pot, a baby's bouncing chair. It has frequently had problems of this kind but recently it is getting out of hand and dangerous to walk through and the area is used often with children going to and from school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairmead Close, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 20th January
item.description:
The bins on Mint Street are always overflowing and there are always a lot of things left there without being taken for weeks. I walk past this place every week day on the way to my son’s school and find it unhygienic and unsanitary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mint Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 82 st margarets terrace, 20th January
item.description:
Fly tipped items amongst overflowing bins. School just nearby. Unacceptable

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Terrace, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped bed near bins, 20th January
item.description:
Obstruction to pavement along with the ridiculous amounts of black bins. There is a nursery just along from here. Terrible for the kids to see and the push chairs to get through.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and uneven surfaces around estate, 20th January
item.description:
There are several potholes around Peabody Estate in Southwark Street, my husband is disabled and has tripped more than once due to the uneven surfaces. These holes have been here for the last 3 years without being fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76-80, Southwark Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 164 burrage road, 20th January
item.description:
This hmo has various articles fly tipped in the front yard and onto pavement. Overflowing bins. Absolutely eyes sore and health hazard. There are six residences in this terraced house. Its outrageous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins obstructing pavements, 20th January
item.description:
There are two green bins unnumbered left in the way of the pavement opposite a tree causing obstruction. Can't get wheelchair or pushchair through. Added to this various bins from no 20 vernham road being left here every bin day should be left on vernham road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish overflowing onto the street, hard to walk around it., 20th January
item.description:
Whenever I walk down this street to take my son to school there is several rubbish bags overflowing with rubbish spilling out onto the street. I have a disabled husband who would like to take our child to school but cannot due to hazards like this. It is also not nice to look at for my child and seems unsafe and unhygienic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Playhouse Court, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaning traffic light pole, 20th January
item.description:
There is a traffic light pole on Euston Road jct Belgrove Street, which has been badly damaged by being hit. It needs urgent attention as it appears to be unstable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Euston Road, King's Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Litter accumulation, 20th January
item.description:
A build up of litter over times the street has not been cleaned in a long time and there is lots of litter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thick mud and dirty dangerous footpath, 20th January
item.description:
The road has thick mud on both the road and pathway. It is incredibly dangerous and needs tidying up

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown footpath, 20th January
item.description:
This is Kentish Road bus stop I have a pram and a young baby I struggle getting off the bus here due to the over grown trees and bushes. It is a safety issue as it is a very crowded area with parked cars on the hill with the path also being blocked by the trees it obscures the view of the road for pedestrians. I also struggle to push my pram along when getting off at the stop using the path to go up to All Saints Church of a Sunday and access to Nuxley road. Pedestrians and public transport users are not valued in the borough shown by the state of the paths, train station and bus stops. Cars are allowed to park right up to the junction on Abbey Crescent and this overgrowth with this issue is an accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Major ‘fake’ roadworks without permit, 20th January
item.description:
Skip and lots of fly tipping extending into the road inside fence blocking parking spaces without suitable permit or lighting. Signs regularly taken from nearby official roadworks creating a hazard
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alabama Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
